data.title: cocos2d-x v3.9 android4.3后的版本getaddrinfo概率闪退
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.9
- devices test on: android4.3以后的所有设备
- developing environments
   - NDK version:android-ndk-r10c
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version: VS 2012
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. 安卓4.3版本以后 getaddrinfo会概率性闪退，以下是通过腾讯BUG收集到的闪退log
#00 pc 00026480 /system/lib/libc.so (__srefill +219) [armeabi-v7a]
2 #01 pc 00025b27 /system/lib/libc.so (fread +358) [armeabi-v7a]
3 #02 pc 00037099 /system/lib/libc.so (android_getaddrinfoforiface +1268) [armeabi-v7a]
4 #03 pc 00037363 /system/lib/libc.so (getaddrinfo +10) [armeabi-v7a]

data.title: SimpleAudioEngine::sharedEngine()->playBackgroundMusic() will stop suddenly with no error
data.body: cocos2d-x V2.6 when i play a mp3 about 1min long, SimpleAudioEngine::sharedEngine()->playBackgroundMusic() will stop suddenly with no error. I test that in Demo TestCpp, meet that again. just meet that on Android .

data.title: Mesh enable depth write by default
data.body: https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/13635 enables depth write by default no matter it is transparent or not. I don't know why, but obviously it is wrong.

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
template proj.visualstudio for android
data.body: This template should be able to run on android simulator with arm architecture. Running android build on visual studio emulator, which support only x86 architecture, may not work properly as expect. No error occurs when building and deploying on emulator, but GLRender is not able to render any single frame causing by glError x0501 and x0502. I'm guessing EGL.so and OpenGLES.so provide by android-ndk-r11c with x86 architecture specific did not support VS android emulator. Still working on it, and hoping for some advice.

data.title: Fixes broken of JS AssetsManagerTest. And updates https configuration of cpp-tests, js-tests for macOS.
Sync JS TerrainTest.js from cpp test.
Sync editbox improvement from cocos creator
data.body:
port the Editbox improvement from Creator.

Fix single line EditBox and multi-line Editbox text alignment.

Now the single line Editbox will be center align vertically and the multi-line Editbox will be top align vertically by default.

It also fix a misusage of Password EditBox on lua tests.

cc.ActionTweenDelegate not exposed to JavaScript bindings on Android
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13
- devices test on: Android
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r12b
   - Xcode version: N/A
   - VS version: N/A
   - browser type and version: N/A

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create new JavaScript class, e.g. var TweenProperty = cc.ActionTweenDelegate.extend({ ... })
2. At runtime, get: D/cocos2d-x debug info: JS: assets/src/TweenProperty.js:1:TypeError: cc.ActionTweenDelegate is undefined

I tried adding "actions" to my "modules" list in project.json and it did not help.

It seems like the auto-generated JavaScript bindings do not define this class.

data.title: use correct downloader implementation on mac
make _fullPathCache of FileUtils thread-safe
data.body:
Adopted a Read-Write SpinLock, since
* Operations on _fullPathCache don't take too long
* Performance for single-threaded apps won't be affected too much

I have made a simple test program, and have the following result

* When thread contention isn't heavy(5 threads reading & writing at the same time), a SpinLock can be 7 times faster than a std::mutex, about 5 times faster than a pthread_rwlock
* When thread contention gets heavy(30 threads reading & writing at the same time), a SpinLock gets a bit slower than pthread_rwlock, but still a little faster than a std::mutex
* If we have more than 30 threads in contention, SpinLock will become slower than a std::mutex at some point

But most of the time, there won't be many threads in contention for the FileUtils' _fullPathCache, I guess 99% of the time there will be no contention, and 99% of the 1% when there is contention, there are only 2 threads, so a SpinLock will be ideal.

I only tested on iOS devices & Mac, I will shared my test program later. @minggo @dumganhar
